html_lawbox:
356 U.S. 273 (1958)

GEORGIA ET AL.
v.
UNITED STATES ET AL.

No. 774.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided April 14, 1958.
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF GEORGIA.

Eugene Cook, Attorney General of Georgia, E. Freeman Leverett, Assistant Attorney General, W. H. Swiggart, E. R. Leigh, Joseph L. Lenihan and W. L. Grubbs for appellants.

Solicitor General Rankin, Assistant Attorney General Hansen, Robert W. Ginnane, Samuel R. Howell and Isaac K. Hay for the United States and the Interstate Commerce Commission, and Henry L. Walker, Arthur J. Dixon and James A. Bistline for the Southern Railway Co. et al., appellees.

PER CURIAM.

The motions to affirm are granted and the judgment is affirmed.

html:
356 U.S. 273

78 S.Ct. 771

2 L.Ed.2d 760

STATE OF GEORGIA, Western & Atlantic Railroad, and Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company, appellants,
v.
UNITED STATES of America, Interstate Commerce Commission, et al.

No. 774.

Supreme Court of the United States

April 14, 1958

Messrs. Eugene Cook, Atty. Gen. of Georgia, E. Freeman Leverett, Asst. Atty. Gen., W. H. Swiggart, E. R. Leigh, Joseph L. Lenihan and W. L. Grubbs, for appellants.

Solicitor General Rankin, Assistant Attorney General Hansen, Messrs. Robert W. Ginnane, Samuel R. Howell and Isaac K. Hay, for the United States and Interstate Commerce Commission.

Messrs. Henry L. Walker, Arthur J. Dixon and James A. Bistline, for appellees Southern Railway Co. and others.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motions to affirm are granted and the judgment is affirmed.
